attributes.action: change the government's approach to assessing and tackling climate change to one which places more responsibility on the government, and is less focused on pressuring civilians to make inconsequential efforts.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The undersigned demand that:

* The government stop claiming that there is a scientific consensus, in the UK or worldwide, on the causes, nature and effects of climate change,
* All scientific studies be taken into account when deciding climate change policy, including those not initiated and/or conducted in the UK, and those conducted independently,
* The government acknowledge that many areas in the UK are without adequate access to public transport, and that any related initiatives designed for major cities will not work when rolled out nationwide,
* The government cease any present or future plans to artificually inflate prices, costs and charges associated with any form of transport via taxes in order to reduce "carbon emissions",
* The government to cease any present or future plans to tax households based on their generated waste,
* The government acknowledge that the vast majority of the ability to "fight climate change" lies in their own hands, rather than in those of individuals.
